summary.p: 8 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 70; Qurʾānic Text: Q 56:27-56:62; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 301 x 203mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragments Marcel 73 (NLR) and Arabe 350 (b) (BNF) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
8 fol. [203]×301 mm (1.48). Support: thin smooth transparent parchment of yellowish color. Writing material: black ink.
Collation: one quire, fol. 1 and 8, 3 and 6, 4 and 5 are bifolia, fol. 2 and 7 are singletons with stubs.
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F / F5H F6H F7H S F8H
Text layout: 125×225 mm (1.8), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: bold D I, with elongated horizontal elements. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: round dots of red, green and yellow color.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – teardrop-shaped medallion in the text line (type 5.1.1), drawn in gold and colors (fol. 4r, 6v); for groups of 10 verses – large medallions drawn with gold, red and green paint in the text line or on the margin, filled with floral patterns, with inscribed number of the verse, type 3.C.II – ثلاثون (fol. 1v), خمسون (fol. 5v); type 1.D.I – اربعون (fol. 3r), ستون (fol. 8r).

Inscriptions: numbers of the surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in ink on the lower margins of fol. 1r and 8r; on other pages numbers of verses are written in pencil on the margins; textological note in French on fol. 3r.
Defects: upper and lower edges of sheets are lost (damaged by rodents?); on some leaves there are imprints of ink from the opposite pages.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “U”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink and old accession number in red pencil “B. 47”.
Old accession numbers: U (on the wrapping), B. 47 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–8v. Surah 56, verses 26(27)–62(62). Incipit: [٭إلا قيلا سلامًا سلامًا] وأصحاب اليمين . Explicit: النشأة الأ[ولى فلو لا تذكرون٭] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 73 (NLR); Arabe 350b (BNF)".
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
